page.title: 20Battle Area, Bridgham
page.content:
Part of Bridgham heath, together with a large area of heathland to the north-west of our block, forms what is known as the Battle Area. This was taken over by the Army in 1940 for training purposes. The inhabitants of 5 villages within the Battle Area had to leave their homes; several families settled in Bridgham. After the war, the area was retained for military training and is a completely closed zone. The Battle Area is a rather mysterious zone, often echoing with explosions and bursts of gunfire.
On the positive side, the Breckland landscape is maintained here and the zone is reported to be an ideal nature reserve, creatures apparently having adapted to intermittent warfare above their heads.
